title: Ambigram Fever

comments.content:
Well, I don't want to be harsh but the only ambigrams here are the DIK and MEW.  
Ambigrams are words that after rotating them 180 degrees look the same... None of MAM symbols does that, neither jimmy (even though I like it most).  
And besides - it probably wasn't very hard to make a MEW ambigram, huh? ;)

If I'm wrong - let me know. I'm not 100% sure...  
- Filip Łysyszyn

Yes, indeed. MEW was easy. :D

And, yes, I'm affraid you are wrong. because actually there are many types of [ambigrams](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818060603/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambigram):  
- MAM is a 'mirror-image' ambigram.  
- jimmy/minim is a 'mirror-image', 'rotational', 'symbiotogram' and 'natural' ambigram.

Damn. Every day (or night in this case) is a school day:)  
Thanks for explaining!  
- Filip Łysyszyn
You're welcome. Good luck with your home-schooling. :D

"beijing" is elegant!

If you're going to talk ambigrams you have to reference the master 'John Langdon' who is credited with inventing them. His site is a great resource of great examples.

----- snip ------  
"In the early 70s, trying to do with words what Dali and Escher did with images, I invented (or discovered) what came to be known as "ambigrams." In 1980, I discovered that Scott Kim had invented them, too, almost at the same time."  
----- snip ------

[John Langdon Website](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818060603/http:/www.johnlangdon.net/background)

Trying to design an ambigram is a great mental exercise and I'd recommend it to every designer looking for a new challenge in creative thinking. Below are a pair of options I did for a friend who was looking for a tattoo idea.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818060603im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Magli-Ambigram_5832.gif)

Yeah, I've got his _Wordplay_ book. one of Langdon's students, Dave Bailey, posts on here from time to time.

"Magli", right? Yeah, that's working & has potential.

(I tend to work on ’em just far enough to see that they're working, but then am too lazy to finesse ’em into something beautiful...)
